ISceneCamera Interface Reference
[SCENE+ Module]

import "sceneplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for ISceneCamera:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

SCENE+ Camera.

A Renderee (ISceneRenderee-derived) object that represents a camera through which the scene is observed.

Being an IKineNode derivative, the camera may be put wherever in the kinematical chain.

Remarks:
  • IsReady checks if the camera is properly initialised with the Create function.
  • PutVisible function switches off the previously active camera, if any. All the time there is exactly one camera that is switched on.
  • see also other rendering-related functions defined in ISceneRenderee.
See also:
FreeWillPlus::SceneCamera implementation class, which implements the camera as a targeted object (IKineTargetedObj)

Definition at line 389 of file sceneplus.idl.

Creating the Camera
Cameras mus be initialised before use

 Creates the camera (details).

HRESULT CreateEx (FWVECTOR vPosition, FWVECTOR vTarget, FWVECTOR vUp)
 Creates the camera using the targeted object metaphore (details).

HRESULT GetCreateParams ([out] FWVECTOR *vPosition,[out] FWVECTOR *vDirection,[out] FWVECTOR *vUp)
 Returns creation values; these values may defer from the given in Create depending on the actual implementation.

The Perspective
Perspective Transform is optional, however its proper use may refine the image

HRESULT PutPerspective ([in] FWFLOAT fFOV,[in] FWFLOAT fClipNear,[in] FWFLOAT fClipFar,[in] FWFLOAT fAspect)
 Puts the perspective projection transformation (left-handed) - see details.

HRESULT GetPerspective ([out] FWFLOAT *pFOV,[out] FWFLOAT *pfClipNear,[out] FWFLOAT *pfClipFar,[out] FWFLOAT *pAspect)
 Gets the perspective projection transformation, left-handed, see PutPerspective for details.

HRESULT GetCurrentCamera ([out, retval] ISceneCamera **p)
 Returns the currently active camera (or NULL if unknown);.

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT ISceneCamera::Create (  FWVECTOR  vPosition,
FWVECTOR  vDirection,
FWVECTOR  vUp
) 
 

Creates the camera (details).

Parameters:
vPosition 3D position of the camera
vDirection Direction in which the camera looks
vUp Vector that determines the vertical direction in the camera image, used to tilt the camera
Remarks:
This function may be called again to change the creation parameters

HRESULT ISceneCamera::CreateEx (  FWVECTOR  vPosition,
FWVECTOR  vTarget,
FWVECTOR  vUp
) 
 

Creates the camera using the targeted object metaphore (details).

Parameters:
vPosition 3D position of the camera
vTarget 3D position of the point towards the camera looks
vUp Vector that determines the vertical direction in the camera image, used to tilt the camera
Remarks:
This function may be called again to change the creation parameters

HRESULT ISceneCamera::PutPerspective (  [in] FWFLOAT  fFOV,
[in] FWFLOAT  fClipNear,
[in] FWFLOAT  fClipFar,
[in] FWFLOAT  fAspect
) 
 

Puts the perspective projection transformation (left-handed) - see details.

Parameters:
fFOV Field of view, in the y direction, in radians
fClipNear Z-value of the near view-plane
fClipFar Z-value of the far view-plane
fAspect Aspect ratio, defined as view space height divided by width, use 0 for automatic value calculated from the window dimensions
